intro: Chamaesyce cinerascens, commonly known as the grayleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of fine, grayish hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small, pale yellow flowers appear in clusters and are often followed by fluffy, seed-bearing capsules.
